intro: Allosorus breweri, commonly known as the Brewster's ghostflower, is a rare and endemic plant found in specific habitats in the southwestern United States. It is a small, herbaceous species with delicate, pale green leaves and tiny, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and crevices. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, branching stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
